summary: The document details the employment and payroll records of Gina I. Resnick, a document clerk for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), under the Assassination Records Review Board. It outlines her hiring process, salary adjustments from $10,000 to $84,000 per annum, and includes memos recommending her employment based on her qualifications. The record is partially postponed to protect privacy, specifically Social Security numbers, with a review date set for 2017, highlighting the balance between public interest and personal privacy in historical records.
key_findings: Gina I. Resnick was appointed as a document clerk for the HSCA with an initial salary of $10,000, adjusted to $19,000, and later to $84,000 per annum.
Employment and payroll authorization forms detail her employment status, salary, and type of employment action.
A recommendation memo from Tom Lambeth, Acting Staff Director, cites Resnick's MLS from the University of Michigan and experience with the Congressional Research Service as key qualifications.
Partial postponement of the record until 2017 was implemented to protect personal privacy, specifically Social Security numbers.
The document emphasizes the critical balance between public interest in historical records and the protection of personal privacy.
